slides.title: Innovation Sprint
slides.subtitle: Turning Hackathon Energy into Sustainable Results

slides.title: The Moment We're In
bullets: GAS Summit & Hackathon proved our people want to innovate
We generated energy, ideas, and enthusiasm
But hackathon energy fades without a system to sustain it
The risk: Ideas die in inboxes. People disengage.
The opportunity: Channel this into a repeatable engine

slides.title: Microsoft Showed Us the Playbook
slides.quote: When you do Kaizen, you'll find a lot of waste. Then you layer in AI.
rows: Unless sponsored, we don't work on it

slides.title: Aligned with Your Strategic Priorities
slides.quote: IT's job is to remove friction — but cost-constrained.
rows: Kaizen finds waste; AI automates pain

slides.title: Workforce Enablement Unlocks Scale
bullets: Level 1: SUMMARIZE — emails, docs, meetings
Level 2: AUTOMATE — action items, routine tasks
Level 3: CREATE — presentations, reports, drafts
Level 4: TRUST — agentic workflows with human oversight
AI is 'jagged' — intuition comes from personal use

slides.title: Why Shared Services First
bullets: High volume, repeatable processes — ideal for Kaizen + AI
Cross-functional visibility — Tim & Nick see impact everywhere
Measurable outcomes — cycle time, errors, cost/transaction
Internal customers — lower risk than client-facing
Quick wins compound — each win builds the case
Microsoft-proven council model

slides.title: What Tim and Nick Will See by Q2
The Scale Path: Earn the Right
bullets: Q1-Q2: Shared Services — Partner with Tim/Nick, deliver 3-5 wins, build playbook
Q3: Digital — Byron champions model, expand to client-facing, train the trainers
Q4+: Global — Regional CIOs adopt, local champions own it, becomes Lockton standard
We don't oversell before we've proven — each phase builds on demonstrated success

slides.title: Addressing the Hard Questions
slides.quote: Bad news is better than uncertainty. Share intent.
rows: Success criteria defined before sprint starts
HR partner involved; process owner leads
No comms until we have wins to show

slides.title: The Ask
bullets: Your sponsorship as IT champion
Introduction to Tim and Nick
Air cover for experimentation
Quarterly visibility on progress

slides.title: Why This, Why Now
bullets: Hackathon momentum — people are energized NOW (energy fades fast)
Microsoft playbook — fresh insights from Seattle, validated approach
Lockton growth targets — $4B → $7.1B requires efficiency, not headcount
Three forces converging — the window is open
